howItWorks.title: How it works
howItWorks.description: TenderPilot helps you understand a tender fast so you can make a go/no-go decision with confidence. It structures RFPs and public tenders into review-ready outputs: mandatory requirements, evaluation criteria, risks and ambiguities, and a proposal outline.
howItWorks.disclaimer: Decision-support only. No legal or procurement advice. Always verify against the original tender document.
howItWorks.outputs_desc: A practical set of artifacts you can review quickly, built for traceability and verification.

sample.decision_text: No clear disqualifier detected, but two points need clarification: submission packaging and acceptance criteria for the support SLA.
actions_list: Confirm submission packaging rules (PDF set + signed declarations).
Clarify acceptance tests and deliverable sign-off process.
Validate ISO 27001 evidence requirements and acceptable alternatives.

mock.m1_desc: Submit through the e-procurement portal before the deadline. Technical and commercial offers as separate PDFs. File naming conventions apply.
mock.m2_desc: Include signed declarations (eligibility, non-collusion, confidentiality). Authority may request additional documentation during clarification.
mock.m3_desc: Tender requests evidence of security controls for processing personal data. Confirm whether ISO 27001 is strictly required or equivalence is accepted.
mock.r1_desc: Acceptance testing is referenced but pass/fail criteria and sign-off roles are not defined. Risk of scope creep and late disputes.
mock.r2_desc: Response times and service hours are unclear (business hours vs 24/7). Confirm escalation path, exclusions, and planned downtime handling.
mock.r3_title: Reference project template may be strict
mock.r3_desc: Annex suggests a fixed structure for references. Confirm if your format is accepted or if a template is mandatory.
key_bullets: Submission via portal; strict file naming rules.
ISO 27001 evidence requested for data processing.
Milestones exist but acceptance tests not defined.
questions: Can you confirm the exact submission packaging rules (file naming, number of files, signatures)?
What are the acceptance test criteria and who provides final sign-off?
Is ISO 27001 mandatory, or are equivalent certifications/controls acceptable?

data.decisionLine: HOLD — Two blockers need clarification before bidding: acceptance testing and SLA penalties.

mustItems.title: Acceptance test criteria and sign-off timeline must be defined
mustItems.evidence: “The supplier shall pass acceptance tests according to Annex 4… Acceptance is confirmed by written sign-off.”

mustItems.title: SLA penalties and service credits must be capped or clarified
mustItems.evidence: “Service credits may be applied for each month below 99.5% availability… no maximum cap specified.”

mustItems.title: Proof of ISO 27001 (or equivalent) must be provided
mustItems.evidence: “The bidder shall provide evidence of an ISO 27001 certified ISMS or equivalent controls.”

mustItems.title: Named key personnel and CVs must be included in the offer
mustItems.evidence: “The bidder shall nominate key experts and include CVs (max 2 pages each).”

risks.title: Scope ambiguity around legacy system integration responsibilities
Unclear ownership of on-site support costs and travel
Bid bond wording may require legal review

questions.q: Can you confirm the acceptance test procedure and acceptance criteria (Annex 4) and the sign-off SLA?
questions.why: This is a blocker for delivery planning and commercial risk.

questions.q: Is there a monthly cap for service credits/penalties tied to SLA availability?
questions.why: Needed to quantify downside exposure and price correctly.

questions.q: Which integration interfaces are in scope, and who owns middleware changes?
questions.why: Clarifies delivery effort and timeline feasibility.

questions.q: Are on-site support days fixed or on-demand, and are travel costs reimbursable?
